animal_concentrations.References: (1) Van den Berg M et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 16: 149-58 (1987) (2) Paasivirta J et al; Chemosphere 16: 1787-90 (1987) (3) Nygren M et al; pp. 17-34 in Chlorinated Dioxins and Dibenzofurans in Perspective. Rappe C et al, eds. Lewis Publ (1986) (4) Weseloh DV et al; J Great Lakes Res 21: 121-37 (1995) (5) Koistinen J et al; Chemosphere 35: 1249-1269 (1997) (6) Jimenez B et al; Environ Sci Technol 32: 3853-61 (1998) (7) Hashimoto S et al; Chemosphere 39: 2661-69 (1999) (8) Bacon CE et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 18: 452-8 (1999)
animal_concentrations.Value: 1,2,3,6,7,8-Hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin was detected in the livers of cormorants (14-460 ng/kg), grey herons (91-263 ng/kg), and a great crested grebe (17 ng/kg) taken from the Netherlands in 1983 and 1984(1). 1,2,3,6,7,8-Hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin was qualitatively identified in an eagle from Finland(2). Fat from a ringed seal taken from Finland in 1978 and muscle from a guillemot taken from Sweden in 1971 contained 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin levels of 69 and 18 ng/kg, respectively(3). The concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in herring gull and double-crested cormorant eggs from Hamilton harbor, Lake Ontario, Ontario, Canada was 7-15 ng/kg wet wt and 19 ng/kg wet wt, respectively, in samples taken in 1984-1991(4). Ringed and gray seal blubber samples were taken from dead animal in the Gulf of Finland during a period of high mortality (years 1991-92); the concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in these samples ranged from 26 to 180 pg/g lipid wt (n=6) for ringed seals and 45 to 110 pg/g lipid wt for grey seals(5). Crabs from the Venice (Italy) lagoon contained 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin at concns ranging from 0.14 to 1.87 pg/g wet wt(6). In sea animals sampled near Hiraiso, Japan; the concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin is as follows (all pg/g wet wt)(7): sea slug (<0.05); sea urchin (0.27); starfish (0.095); mussel (0.18); snail (<0.05). Between 1988-1992, the concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in livers sampled from sea otters was 1.57 and 0.71 ng/kg wet wt, respectively, from California and the Aleutian Islands (Alaska)(8).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Kannan K et al; Environ Sci Technol 35: 441-7 (2001) (2) Kumar KS et al; Environ Sci Technol 35: 3448-55 (2001) (3) Stalling DL et al; Chemosphere 14: 627-43 (1985)
animal_concentrations.Value: Double-crested cormorants and herring gulls taken from the Michigan waters of the Great Lakes were analyzed for chemical contaminants in May 1998(1). The concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin of in doubled-crested cormorants taken from Little Charity Is, Scarecrow Is, and Taquamenon Is were 18.2 pg/g wet wt (range, 16-20 pg/g wet wt), 1.6 pg/g wet wt (range, 0.2-3.3 pg/g wet wt), and 4.1 pg/g wet wt (range, 2.4-7.4 pg/g wet wt), respectively(1). The concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in herring gulls taken from Little Charity Is, Scarecrow Is, and Taquamenon Is were <0.1 pg/g wet wt, 3.6 pg/g wet wt (range, 2.9-4.2 pg/g wet wt), and <0.1 pg/g wet wt, respectively(1). Animals collected by tribes in Coimbatore, India near the Ganges River contained 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin at concns as follows (all pg/g fat wt)(2): eagle (muscle, 16); prairie kite (muscle, 120); osprey (muscle, 76); back-winged kite (muscle, 45); spotted owlet (120); Ganges dolphin (blubber, 6.4). Samples of herring gull eggs taken from Snake Island, Lake Ontario in 1983 contained 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin levels of 14-31 ng/kg(3).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Van den Berg M et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 16: 149-58 (1987) (2) Nygren M et al; pp. 17-34 in Chlorinated Dioxins and Dibenzofurans in Perspective. Rappe C et al, eds. Lewis Publ (1986) (3) Kumar KS et al; Environ Sci Technol 35: 3448-3455 (2001) (4) Huestis SY et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 16: 154-64 (1997) (5) Fiedler H et al; Chemosphere 37: 1645-56 (1998)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: 1,2,3,6,7,8-Hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin was detected in eels (3.3-6.0 ng/kg) collected at six locations in the Netherlands in the early 1980s(1). Muscle tissue from a salmon collected from the Ume River in Sweden in 1978 was found to contain a 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin concn of 6.6 ng/kg(2). Freshwater fish from Tamil Nadu, India contained 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin at levels as follows (all pg/g fat wt)(3): bhavani (0.4); chennai (0.8); patna (9.4); farakka (4.0). Lake trout collected from the eastern basin of Lake Ontario between the years 1977 to 1993 contained 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin as follows (year; mean concn as pg/g lipid wt): 1977, 6.50; 1978, 4.52; 1980, 3.35; 1981, 2.74; 1982, 4.09; 1983, 3.61; 1984, 4.18; 1986, 2.69; 1987, 3.31; 1988, 4.54; 1989, 3.82; 1990, 4.57; 1991, 3.70; 1992, 3.06; 1993, 2.17(4). Farm-raised catfish from Mississippi, Alabama, and Arkansas contained significant levels of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin(5); for example, brand A nuggets, 7.0-7.6 pg/g lipid (n=3); brand A filet, 17-25 pg/g lipid (n=3); brand B filet, 15 (n=1); Mississippi commercial, 4.2-12 (n=3); Arkansas commercial, 5.7-6.1 (n=2)(5).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Rappe C, Kjeller L; Chemosphere 16: 1775-80 (1987) (2) Rotard W et al; Chemosphere 29: 2193-200 (1994) (3) Schuhmacher M et al; Chemosphere 37: 2127-37 (1998)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: Soils from three rural areas of Europe contained 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin levels below 2 ng/kg while two soils from industrialized areas contained levels of 19-64 ng/kg(1). In a rural district in the western part of Germany, the mean concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin was determined in the following in soils (all ng/kg dry matter)(2): plowland, 1.5 (n=14; range, 1.1-1.8); grassland, 1.9 (n=7; range, 1.4-2.9); deciduous forests, 12.4 (n=9; range, 3.1-49.4); and coniferous forests, 11.1 (n=11; range, 3.7-28.8). The concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin ranged from 0.25 to 0.54 ng/kg dry matter in soil samples collected 4-6 km from the stack of a municipal solid waste incinerator located near Tarragona, Spain(3).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Ballschmiter K et al; Chemosphere 15: 901-15 (1986) (2) Rappe C, Kjeller L; Chemosphere 16: 1775-80 (1987) (3) Bruckmeier BFA et al; Environ Pollut 95: 19-25 (1997) (4) Jimenez B et al; Environ Sci Technol 32: 3853-61 (1998) (5) Bellucci LG et al; Mar Pollut Bull 40: 65-76 (2000) (6) Kannan K et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 20: 1878-89 (2001)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: Hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxins have been detected in sediments from Lake Lugano, Switzerland, Lake Siskiwit (Michigan) and the Danube River Southwest Germany(1). 1,2,3,6,7,8-Hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin concns of 2.0-48 ng/kg were identified in sediments collected from the archipelago of Stockholm, Sweden(2). The concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in sediments of Grober Arbersee (near Bayerisch-Eisenstein in the Bavarian Forest, southeast Germany) increased between the approx years 1951 to 1993(3); between the years 1865-1918, it was not detected; 1951-1957, 0.89 ng/kg dry wt; 1957-1963, 1.07 ng/kg dry wt; 1963-1968, 2.11 ng/kg dry wt; 1968-1972, 1.88 ng/kg dry wt; 1972-1977, 4.57 ng/kg dry wt; 1977-1981, 4.40 ng/kg dry wt; 1981-1985, 9.63 ng/kg dry wt; 1991-1993, 7.61 ng/kg dry wt(3). Sediments from the Venice (Italy) lagoon contained 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin at concns ranging from 0.08 to 3.35 pg/g dry wt(4). At 18 sites in the Venice lagoon (Italy), the concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in surficial sediments ranged from <0.002 to 0.208 ug/kg(5). In 1998, the concn of 1,2,3,6,7,8-hexachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin in sediments from the upper Detroit and Rouge rivers ranged from 0.72-51.6 (n=6) and 28.3-43.1 (n=4) pg/g dry wt, respectively(6).
